content.user_title: Profile performance bottlenecks in your code
content.value_statement: Applications often suffer from undetected performance issues that impact user experience and costs. This skill provides automated multi-dimensional profiling across CPU, memory, I/O, and network to identify bottlenecks and generate actionable optimization recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Profile CPU usage and identify hot paths with flame graph visualization
Detect memory leaks and analyze heap snapshots
Analyze database queries for slow performance and N+1 patterns
Profile network requests and external API calls
Compare performance before and after optimizations
limitations: Requires compatible profiling tools installed (perf, clinic.js, etc.)
Profiling adds 5-30% overhead depending on mode
Cannot profile production systems without proper permissions
Optimization suggestions require manual review before applying

output_examples.input: Profile my application with standard CPU and memory analysis
output: Baseline: 1,247 req/s, P95 latency 456ms, CPU 67%, Memory 512 MB
CPU Bottleneck: processData() uses 34.5% CPU - O(n²) algorithm
Memory Leak: SessionManager event listeners not removed - 2.3 MB/hour growth
Recommendation: Replace nested loops with hash map for 3.2x throughput improvement

best_practices: Profile under realistic load conditions to identify real-world bottlenecks
Use quick mode (30s) for initial scans and deep mode (30min) for comprehensive analysis
Always save a baseline before making optimizations for accurate comparison
Run benchmark suite after applying optimizations to verify improvements
anti_patterns: Profiling idle applications - always generate realistic workload during profiling
Ignoring p95/p99 latency metrics - focus on tail latency, not just averages
Applying optimizations without running tests first - always verify functionality
Profiling production without proper permissions - use staging environments first

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Node.js (v8-profiler, clinic.js), Python (cProfile, py-spy), Java (JProfiler, VisualVM). More via custom profilers.

faq.question: What is the performance overhead of profiling?
faq.answer: Quick mode adds 5-10% overhead, Standard adds 10-20%, Deep adds 20-30%. Continuous sampling adds less than 5%.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Supports GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Circle CI, and Jenkins. Use --baseline and --compare to detect regressions.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe during profiling?
faq.answer: Yes. Profiling runs locally, only reads your codebase and generates reports locally. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why are no bottlenecks detected?
faq.answer: Increase profiling duration or run under higher load. Quick mode may miss intermittent issues. Use deep mode for thorough analysis.

faq.question: How does this compare to other profiling tools?
faq.answer: Combines multiple profiling dimensions into one workflow. Provides automated optimization generation and integration with Claude Code agents.
